channel.title: Need help with adding 377 cache to 317 client
channel.description:
When I try to do Harvey's tut on adding 377 cache to a 317 client I always get a error when I run the client. I did everything properly and get in run.batch:
It stops at client face: Loading Cache - 20% and in run.batch I get...
[code] ondemand java.lang.NullPointerException at java.applet.Applet.getAppletContext(Unknown Source) at client.getAppletContext(client.java:2674) at client.method28(client.java:863) at client.method6(client.java:7051) at Applet_Sub1.run(Applet_Sub1.java:51) at client.run(client.java:4515) at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source) [/code]
Got a new signlink.java and everything.
If anyone wants to post a fixed 317 deob with 377 cache that would be great ;)

item.title: Need help with adding 377 cache to 317 client
item.dc:creator: @ThatOneServer Mike_
item.description:
@ThatOneServer wrote:

Sin_:

Servers and clients are not real Java. Yet you might as well think that. Just stay off my thread then. Anyone might as well know clients and servers, so they think they know Java.

I never heard of pseudo-java

Read full topic

item.title: Need help with adding 377 cache to 317 client
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

[quote=“Evan_, post:32, topic:156132”][quote author=Sin_ link=topic=213031.msg1860971#msg1860971 date=1193984663]

Clients are still Java. The other day you were acting like that “Java God” so you should obviously have no problem fixing this. Anyways, I’d rather not get in trouble. But like I said:

best of luck with the errors.

Servers and clients are not real Java. Yet you might as well think that. Just stay off my thread then. Anyone might as well know clients and servers, so they think they know Java.
[/quote]It’s fucking java.Making a server is harder then making a java gui or anything so basiclly incorporating a game with java is real java.[/quote]
Not really. Making a server is simply opening up a Socket… Making a Runescape server would be harder then making a Java GUI.

Read full topic
